name: German Stollen with Marzipan
description: This German stollen with dried fruits, almonds, and marzipan is so delicious! It's made with Christmas spices and it's just the perfect treat for the holiday season. My recipe is of course 100% vegan. No butter, milk, or eggs required.
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup soy milk ((it should have room temperature))

recipeInstructions.text: In a small pot, melt the margarine over low heat and let it cool down for a bit.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small pot, melt the margarine over low heat and let it cool down for a bit.

recipeInstructions.text: In the meantime, combine the flour, the dry yeast, the sugar, the milk, the rum, the ground almonds, and the spices in a mixing bowl. Add the melted margarine and knead all ingredients into a dough. Form a ball, cover it with plastic wrap, and let it rise at a warm place for about 2 hours.
recipeInstructions.name: In the meantime, combine the flour, the dry yeast, the sugar, the milk, the rum, the ground almonds, and the spices in a mixing bowl. Add the melted margarine and knead all ingredients into a dough. Form a ball, cover it with plastic wrap, and let it rise at a warm place for about 2 hours.

recipeInstructions.text: When the dough is ready, gently gold in the dried apricots, the raisins and the candied lemon and oranges.
recipeInstructions.name: When the dough is ready, gently gold in the dried apricots, the raisins and the candied lemon and oranges.

recipeInstructions.text: Form the marzipan into a longish role. Roll the dough into a 9 by 13-inch rectangle. Place the marzipan in the middle of the rectangle and fold one side of the stollen over the marzipan.
recipeInstructions.name: Form the marzipan into a longish role. Roll the dough into a 9 by 13-inch rectangle. Place the marzipan in the middle of the rectangle and fold one side of the stollen over the marzipan.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F and bake for 45 minutes. Cover with aluminium foil if necessary (if it gets too brown).
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350°F and bake for 45 minutes. Cover with aluminium foil if necessary (if it gets too brown).

recipeInstructions.text: When the stollen is ready, melt the remaining margarine. Immediately coat the stollen with the melted margarine and sprinkle with powdered sugar.
recipeInstructions.name: When the stollen is ready, melt the remaining margarine. Immediately coat the stollen with the melted margarine and sprinkle with powdered sugar.

recipeInstructions.text: The stollen is best when you prepare it in advance and let it sit for at least 2 weeks (it should be wrapped and stored at a cool place).
